attributes.name: Taj Mahal
attributes.description: The Taj Mahal is an iconic white marble mausoleum in Agra. It was built by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
attributes.address: Dharmapuri, Forest Colony, Tajganj, Agra, Uttar Pradesh 282001

attributes.name: Jaipur
attributes.description: Jaipur, known as the Pink City, is the capital of the Indian state of Rajasthan. It is famous for its magnificent palaces, forts, and vibrant markets.

attributes.name: Kerala Backwaters
attributes.description: The Kerala Backwaters is a network of interconnected canals, rivers, and lakes. It offers scenic boat rides and a glimpse into the peaceful rural life of Kerala.

attributes.name: Varanasi
attributes.description: Varanasi, also known as Benaras or Kashi, is one of the oldest inhabited cities in the world. It is a sacred city for Hindus and a major pilgrimage site.

attributes.name: Mysore Palace
attributes.description: The Mysore Palace is a magnificent royal palace located in Mysore, Karnataka. It is known for its Indo-Saracenic architecture and hosts a grand illumination every Sunday.

attributes.name: Golden Temple
attributes.description: The Golden Temple, also known as Sri Harmandir Sahib, is a sacred Sikh shrine in Amritsar. Its gold-plated exterior and serene surroundings attract millions of visitors.
attributes.address: Golden Temple Rd, Atta Mandi, Katra Ahluwalia, Amritsar, Punjab 143006

attributes.name: Goa Beaches
attributes.description: Goa is famous for its stunning beaches along the Arabian Sea. It offers a mix of beautiful coastlines, vibrant nightlife, water sports, and a laid-back atmosphere.

attributes.name: Ajanta and Ellora Caves
attributes.description: The Ajanta and Ellora Caves are a UNESCO World Heritage site in Maharashtra. They showcase magnificent rock-cut sculptures and ancient Buddhist, Jain, and Hindu temples.

attributes.name: Kashmir
attributes.description: Kashmir is often referred to as 'Paradise on Earth' due to its breathtaking natural beauty. It is known for its snow-capped mountains, serene lakes, and picturesque valleys.

attributes.name: Hampi
attributes.description: Hampi is a UNESCO World Heritage site located in Karnataka. It is home to the ruins of the Vijayanagara Empire and features ancient temples, monuments, and stunning landscapes.
